questions.question: Write SQL command to create SALESMAN table
questions.answer:
MySQL:

CREATE TABLE salesman (
  salesman_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(25),
  city VARCHAR(25),
  commission DECIMAL(4,2)
);

Oracle SQL Developer:

CREATE TABLE salesman (
  salesman_id NUMBER(4) PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR2(25),
  city VARCHAR2(25),
  commission NUMBER(4,2)
);

questions.question: Insert records into SALESMAN table
questions.answer:
MySQL:

INSERT INTO salesman VALUES
(5001, 'James Hoog', 'New York', 0.15),
(5002, 'Nail Knite', 'Paris', 0.13),
(5005, 'Pit Alex', 'London', 0.11),
(5006, 'Mc Lyon', 'Paris', 0.14),
(5007, 'Paul Adam', 'Rome', 0.13),
(5003, 'Lauson Hen', 'San Jose', 0.12);

Oracle SQL Developer:

INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5001, 'James Hoog', 'New York', 0.15);
INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5002, 'Nail Knite', 'Paris', 0.13);
INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5005, 'Pit Alex', 'London', 0.11);
INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5006, 'Mc Lyon', 'Paris', 0.14);
INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5007, 'Paul Adam', 'Rome', 0.13);
INSERT INTO salesman VALUES (5003, 'Lauson Hen', 'San Jose', 0.12);
COMMIT;

questions.question: Write SQL command to create CUSTOMER table
questions.answer:
MySQL:

CREATE TABLE customer (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  cust_name VARCHAR(25),
  city VARCHAR(25),
  grade INT,
  salesman_id INT
);

Oracle SQL Developer:

CREATE TABLE customer (
  customer_id NUMBER(4) PRIMARY KEY,
  cust_name VARCHAR2(25),
  city VARCHAR2(25),
  grade NUMBER(3),
  salesman_id NUMBER(4)
);

title: Salesman and Customer from Same City

questions.question: Find salesman and customer who live in the same city
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT s.name AS salesman_name, c.cust_name, s.city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.city = c.city;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT s.name AS salesman_name, c.cust_name, s.city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.city = c.city;

questions.question: Find salesman and the customers he represents
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT s.name AS salesman_name, c.cust_name
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT s.name AS salesman_name, c.cust_name
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id;

questions.question: Find salesmen whose commission is more than 12 percent
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT name, commission
FROM salesman
WHERE commission > 0.12;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT name, commission
FROM salesman
WHERE commission > 0.12;

title: Customers and Salesman from Different Cities

questions.question: Find customers and salesman where cities are different and commission > 12%
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT c.cust_name, s.name AS salesman_name,
       c.city AS customer_city, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id
WHERE s.city <> c.city
AND s.commission > 0.12;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT c.cust_name, s.name AS salesman_name,
       c.city AS customer_city, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id
WHERE s.city <> c.city
AND s.commission > 0.12;

title: Customers Not Living in Same City as Salesman

questions.question: Find customers who do not live in the same city as their salesman
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT c.cust_name, c.city AS customer_city, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id
WHERE s.city <> c.city;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT c.cust_name, c.city AS customer_city, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM salesman s
JOIN customer c
ON s.salesman_id = c.salesman_id
WHERE s.city <> c.city;

questions.question: Display customer name, city, grade, salesman name and city
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT c.cust_name, c.city, c.grade, s.name AS salesman_name, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM customer c
JOIN salesman s
ON c.salesman_id = s.salesman_id;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT c.cust_name, c.city, c.grade, s.name AS salesman_name, s.city AS salesman_city
FROM customer c
JOIN salesman s
ON c.salesman_id = s.salesman_id;

questions.question: Find customers with grade less than 300
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT cust_name, grade
FROM customer
WHERE grade < 300;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT cust_name, grade
FROM customer
WHERE grade < 300;

questions.question: Display customers ordered by customer_id
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT * FROM customer ORDER BY customer_id;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT * FROM customer ORDER BY customer_id;

questions.question: Find customers who have not placed any order
questions.answer:
MySQL:

SELECT cust_name FROM customer WHERE grade IS NULL;

Oracle SQL Developer:

SELECT cust_name FROM customer WHERE grade IS NULL;
